column4: i was just making the point that you seem to have less functionality with 64bit in my oppinion , but i dont really know anything so boooo
is the 64 bit version safer from viruses/malware?
No.  But 32 bit is still remarkably safe compared to windows
Yeah, that's the main advantage of 64bit OS / hardware
No.  Because reading the data off the hdd still has a static speed.  If you striped (via a raid) it would be.
*it would be faster.  But probably not 4300 + 4300 faster.
Striping definitely has a performance increase, that's the point of it.  Weather it's drive1 + drive2 or now I don't know.  Seems unlikely to me that it is though.  There is probably some overhead.
All I can say for sure is that the performance while striping is at least the speed of the slowest drive but not more than the combined speeds of both drives
For example, you can spin and read data off of both hdd's at the same time.  This would obviously be 2X's the slower drive, but the processor still can only read 1 stream at a time.
What?
I didn't realize you had 3 drives.  What is your question then?  (I answered the performance question right?)
ok
There isn't one.  Closest thing is gconf-editor
Modular (in a general sense) means the parts can easily be removed and replaced.
What is?  Having a registry?
There are pros. For example reading from the registry is faster than individual files.
The lack of modularity increases complexity.  That is something I don't like.
Well the lack of modularity is not what makes windows less secure than linux.
The cost of what?
The registry?
Do you have an Ubuntu related question?  Hating windows is not the point of linux or this channel.
